content:
You are the Executor Agent.
You will be given a single step from a plan to execute.
You have access to a variety of tools to help you complete the step.
Your goal is to complete the step as efficiently as possible, using tools as needed, and then provide a final answer that addresses the user's original objective.

# Important rules
Tool catalogue
A catalogue of callable tools appears below the conversation. Use only those tools. Do not invent tools or URLs.

Execution protocol
1. Tool phase
   ‚Ä¢ Your first reply must contain only the function call(s) needed to execute this single step.
   ‚Ä¢ If this step depends on links discovered earlier, read the conversation history and call tools accordingly.
   ‚Ä¢ If you do not yet have at least one usable source URL for every fact you will state, issue additional tool-only replies to obtain sources. For upr.si pages, only call get_web_page_content after discovery tools have returned a promising upr.si link.

2. Answer phase
   ‚Ä¢ After tool responses arrive and you have sufficient sources, send one Markdown reply that fulfils this step.

Answer-phase requirements
‚Ä¢ Use only information actually returned by tools in this conversation. Do not fabricate or guess.
‚Ä¢ Cite each fact immediately after it with a numbered inline citation: [1](https://example.com).
‚Ä¢ End with a ‚Äú## References‚Äù section listing every URL in order of first appearance, one per line with its number.
‚Ä¢ Include all relevant links you uncovered. Every link must originate from tool outputs in this conversation.
‚Ä¢ Respond in valid Markdown exactly as illustrated. It is extremely important all links are correctly written.

URL safety rules
‚Ä¢ Never type a URL that is not explicitly present in tool output. Copy URLs verbatim from tool results.
‚Ä¢ Do not invent domains or paths. Never use placeholders like example.com.
‚Ä¢ Do not normalize, expand, or ‚Äúfix‚Äù URLs. Preserve http vs https, trailing slashes, query strings, anchors, and case exactly as returned.
‚Ä¢ Ignore malformed or partial links that lack a domain or scheme. If all returned links are unusable, run another tool phase to obtain usable URLs before answering.
‚Ä¢ If a fact has no corresponding URL in tool outputs, either do another tool call to fetch a source or omit the fact.

Pre-answer URL checklist
Before sending the answer, ensure all of the following are true:
‚Ä¢ Each cited number [n] maps to a unique URL that appeared in tool outputs.
‚Ä¢ The same URL keeps the same number everywhere.
‚Ä¢ No URL is invented, edited, or inferred.
‚Ä¢ The number of citations in the answer equals the number of URLs in ‚Äú## References‚Äù.

Citation example

# Answer

The programme coordinator is Dr. Jane Doe [1](http://example.com/dr-jane-doe).
Admission requires a completed bachelor‚Äôs degree [2](http://example.com/admission-requirements).

## References
[1] http://example.com/dr-jane-doe
[2] http://example.com/admission-requirements

    skip and DO NOT include references if there is no relevant links. 
    Never use example.com or similar placeholders.
Call ask_about_rules_and_acts with question set to What is the official deadline for submitting the bachelor's thesis at FAMNIT and k set to 3. Return any relevant passages, rules, or links.

arguments.question: What is the official deadline for submitting the bachelor's thesis at FAMNIT

            Source: https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189

            Document location: [https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189](https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189)

# Rules on the preparation and defence of the Final Thesis in the master study programme at the University of Primorska
## I. General provisions
### Article 1
(Contents of the Rules)
(1) These Rules regulate the process of selecting and applying for the topic of the Final Thesis in the master study programme, its substantive and formal application, preparation and defence.
(2) Individual procedures for which these Rules foresee a more detailed regulation at the level of the University's faculties (hereinafter: faculties) shall be regulated in detail by the relevant legal act of the individual faculty.
(3) The provisions of the faculty's legal act referred to in the previous paragraph of this Article shall not contravene these Rules.
### Article 2
(The use of the term "organizational unit")
In these Rules, the term "organizational unit of the faculty" (hereafter referred to as OU) refers to the chair or the department, which is determined by the faculty in an internal legal act.
### Article 3
(Language of procedures and documentation)
(1) The procedures and documentation defined in these Rules shall be conducted and prepared in the Slovene language.
(2) In the study programmes conducted in a foreign language, the procedures and documentation defined in these Rules may be conducted or prepared in the English language.
### Article 4
(Neutral grammatical form)
In these Rules, the third person plural grammatical form is used as neutral for men and women.
            
            ---

            

            ---
            Source: https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189

            Passage content: 
            
            Document location: [https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189](https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189)

# Rules on the preparation and defence of the Final Thesis in the master study programme at the University of Primorska
On the basis of Article 38 of the Statute of the University of Primorska (Official Gazette of the Republic of Slovenia, No. 51/15-UPB2, and amendments), at the 34<sup>th</sup> regular session of the University of Primorska on 14 December 2022, the Senate of the University of Primorska adopted the following
# Rules on the preparation and defence of the Final Thesis in the master study programme at the University of Primorska
(Unofficial consolidated text)
            
            ---

            

            ---
            Source: https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189

            Passage content: 
            
            Document location: [https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189](https://www.upr.si/files/static/2189)

# Rules on the preparation and defence of the Final Thesis in the master study programme at the University of Primorska
## V. Confirmation of the topic of the Final Thesis and the mentor/co-mentor
### Article 13
(Confirmation of the topic of the Final Thesis)
(1) When the competent office of the faculty receives the completed application for the topic of the Final Thesis, it checks whether the student meets the criteria for the application for the topic. In the case of formal deficiencies in the application, the student is asked to remedy the identified deficiencies. If the criteria are met and the application is formally complete, the competent office forwards the application with attachments to the competent body of the faculty and the OU.
(2) The topic of the Final Thesis, the mentor and potential co-mentor are checked by the competent body of the faculty, which can return the application to the student if it does not agree with it. If there are no comments, the competent body confirms the topic of the Final Thesis, the proposed mentor and possible co-mentor, and the possible preparation and/or defence of the Final Thesis in another language (Form 2: Decision on the confirmation of the topic of the Final Thesis in the master study programme).
(3) The competent office records the approved topic of the Final Thesis in VIS/≈†IS, the mentor and possible co-mentor, and informs the student, mentor and possible co-mentor.
(4) If the competent body of the faculty rejects the topic of the Final Thesis, the student has to register a new topic.
(5) If the competent body of the faculty rejects the proposed mentor, it shall propose an appropriate mentor to the student.
### Article 14
(Resigning from the approved topic)
(1) If, during the preparation of the Final Thesis, the student realizes that they cannot prepare the thesis, they may request to resign from the topic.
(2) The student sends a reasoned request to the competent body of the faculty, which considers it in cooperation with the mentor and possible co-mentor and makes a decision within fifteen (15) working days as a rule, or at the first following regular session. If the competent body of the faculty grants the request, the student may register a new topic of the Final Thesis.
(3) A student may request to resign from the approved Final Thesis topic only once.
            
            ---

The query requested the official deadline for submitting a bachelor's thesis at FAMNIT using `ask_about_rules_and_acts`. However, all provided passages are from **Rules on Final Thesis Preparation/Defense *in the Master Study Programme*** (not bachelor's). The rules explicitly apply to master-level studies and do not address bachelor's theses. 

No mention of submission deadlines for bachelor's theses appears in any of the documents. The relevant regulations pertain only to master programs, as confirmed by:
- Document title: *"Rules on the preparation and defence of the Final Thesis in the master study programme..."*
- Article 13 (topic confirmation) and Article 14 (resignation from thesis topic) describe procedures for *master* studies.

**Conclusion**: The provided documents do not contain information about bachelor's thesis deadlines at FAMNIT, as they exclusively govern *master* program requirements. A separate source specific to bachelor's theses would be needed.
Call retrieve_similar_FAQ with question set to What is the deadline for submitting the bachelor's thesis at FAMNIT? and k set to 6. Return any FAQ entries that mention the submission deadline.

Score: 0.7825885

Keywords: re-enrollment, repeating a year, student status extension, enrollment requirements, ≈†IS request

Question:
When is the enrollment call typically published for the upcoming academic year at FAMNIT?

Answer:
The call for enrollment for the 2023/24 academic year will be published on the FAMNIT website in January 2023. The link for enrollment information is: https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/enrolment.

---


---

Score: 0.76059735

Keywords: elective course change, SIS, course registration, FAMNIT, deadline

Question:
What is the procedure and deadline for changing an elective course registration for first-semester courses at FAMNIT?

Answer:
The deadline for submitting requests to change elective courses for first-semester courses is typically before the end of the semester registration period, and in this case, the deadline was set for the day after the initial inquiry, at 12:00.

---


---

Score: 0.7517313

Keywords: doctoral dissertation, assessment committee, dissertation review, doctoral defense, academic regulations

Question:
What are the deadlines and responsibilities for members of a doctoral dissertation assessment committee at UP FAMNIT?

Answer:
Members of the doctoral dissertation assessment committee must submit their individual assessment reports within 45 days of receiving the dissertation. These reports must be sent to the president of the commission, who is responsible for preparing a joint report within 15 days of receiving all individual reports.

---


---

Score: 0.70989555

Keywords: exam re-take, retake policy, academic regulations, course repetition, University of Primorska, Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences, and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)

Question:
What is the deadline for re-taking an exam after passing it at the University of Primorska, Faculty of Mathematics, Natural Sciences and Information Technologies (FAMNIT)?

Answer:
A student may re-take an exam only by the end of the academic year immediately following the academic year in which the exam was first passed.

---


---

Score: 0.70964044

Keywords: diploma thesis, thesis defense, graduation consent, thesis submission, deadline extension

Question:
How do I submit the Graduation Consent form for my diploma thesis defense at UP FAMNIT?

Answer:
The Graduation Consent form can be accessed by logging into the ≈†IS portal, navigating to 'My Data', and then selecting 'Completion of Studies', where the form titled 'Consensus at Graduation' is available for download and submission.

---


---

Score: 0.7022957

Keywords: oral defense, thesis defense, Zoom meeting, defense scheduling, virtual defense

Question:
What is the process for scheduling and confirming an oral defense for an undergraduate thesis at UP FAMNIT?

Answer:
The oral defense is scheduled through coordination between the Student and their Supervisor. Once a date and time are agreed upon, the Student Office confirms the arrangement and proceeds with further logistics.

---

Application for enrolment

print
Current application deadlines ‚Äã Application procedures for UNDERGRADUATE studies 2025/26 Application procedures for POSTGRADUATE studies 2025/26 Co-funding tuition fees in doctoral studies¬† Year Plus Recognition of foreign diplomas Enrolment and tuition fees

Visit the page Welcome UP for information about visas and permits, healh insurance and other useful information.

¬†

Current application deadlines

  • September 4 ‚Äì September 11, 2025: Second application period for enrollment in the 1st year of master's studies for Slovenian citizens, citizens of EU member states, and Slovenians without Slovenian citizenship.
  • September 4 ‚Äì September 11, 2025: Third application period for enrollment in the 1st year of master's studies for foreigners from non-EU countries.
  • September 4 ‚Äì September 11, 2025: Second application period for enrollment in the 1st year of doctoral studies for Slovenian citizens and citizens of EU member states.
  • September 4 ‚Äì September 11, 2025: Thirs application period for enrollment in the 1st year of doctoral studies for foreigners from non-EU countries and Slovenians without Slovenian citizenship.

‚ÄãApplication procedures for UNDERGRADUATE studies 2025/26top

CALL FOR ENROLMENT¬†for undergraduate study programmes¬†2025/26 (includes¬†admission requirements for study programmes, criteria for selection, number of places available,...):

  • Common provisions¬†(will be available later; the Slovene version is available here)
  • The official call for enrolment for UP FAMNIT
  • Enrollment place for the academic year 2025/26
  • Complete Call for enrolment (will be available later; the Slovene version is available here)

The APPLICATION MUST BE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY on the web portal eV≈†: https://portal.evs.gov.si/prijava/?lang=en.

Candidates send the electronic application and the required documentation via the eV≈† web portal.

INSTRUCTIONS FOR COMPLETING THE APPLICATION are available¬†here.

(a video of how to fill an application for 1st cycle study programmes is also available)

Application terms for non-EU citizens¬†for the enrolment in the 1st year of study:

  • first application term: from 18 February to 30 June 2025 (CONCLUDED),
  • second application term: from 22 July to 30 July 2025 (NO AVAILABLE PLACES),
  • third application term: from 20 August to 3 September 2025 (CONCLUDED),
  • fourth application term: from 24 to 25 September 2024 (until 10:00).

Application terms for EU citizens and Slovene nationals without Slovene citizenship¬†for the enrolment in the 1st year of study:

  • first application term: from 18 February to 18 March 2025 (CONCLUDED),
  • second application term: from 20 to 27 August 2025 (CONCLUDED),
  • third application term: from 24 to 25 September 2025 (until 10:00).

Application term for enrolment in the higher year of study and for parallel studies:

Candidates can apply from 1 to 15 September 2025.

Application procedures for POSTGRADUATE studies 2025/26top

CALL FOR ENROLMENT for postgraduate study programmes 2025/26 (includes admission requirements for study prog - rammes, criteria for selection, number of places available,...):

  • The call for enrolment for Master's study programmes UP FAMNIT;¬†Common provisions for Master's study programmes
  • The call for enrolment for doctoral study programmes UP FAMNIT;¬†Common provisions for doctoral study programmes

The APPLICATION MUST BE SUBMITTED ELECTRONICALLY on the web portal eV≈†: http://portal.evs.gov.si/prijava/?locale=en.

INSTRUCTIONS FOR COMPLETING THE APPLICATION are available¬†here.

(a video of how to fill an application for 2nd and 3rd cycle study programmes is also available)

Application terms for MASTER'S study programmes:

EU citizens & Slovene nationals without Slovene citizenship:

  • first application term: from 8 April to 21 August 2025 (CONCLUDED),
  • second application term: from 4 to 11 September 2025 (ONGOING),
  • third application term: from 24 to 25 September 2025 (until¬†10:00).

Non-EU citizens:

  • first application term: from 8 April to 5 August 2025 (CONCLUDED),
  • second application term: from 13 to 21 August 2025 ¬†(CONCLUDED),
  • third application term: from 4 to 11 September 2025 (ONGOING),
  • fourth application term: from 24 to 25 September 2025 (until 10:00).

Application terms for DOCTORAL study programmes:

EU citizens:

  • first application term: from 8 April to 21 August 2025 ¬†(CONCLUDED),
  • second application term: from 4 to 11 September 2025 (ONGOING),
  • third application term: from 24 to 25 September 2025 (until¬†10:00).

Non-EU citizens &¬†Slovene nationals without Slovene citizenship:

  • first application term: from 8 April to 5 August 2025 (CONCLUDED),
  • second application term: from 13 to 21 August 2025 ¬†(CONCLUDED),¬†
  • third application term: from 4 to 11 September 2025 (ONGOING),
  • fourth application term: from 24 to 25 September 2025 (until 10:00).

Candidates for the doctoral studies

Candidates for enrolment in the doctoral study programmes must do the following:

  • hold an interview with the study programme Coordinator after the submission of the application,
  • choose a mentor and obtain his written agreement before enrolling.

Candidates for the enrollment in the programme Computer Science¬†must send in the admission procedure to Student Services (referat@famnit.upr.si) the documents showing that they have acquired knowledge in the undergraduate or Master's studies from the following fields:¬†Data Structures and Algorithms, Theoretical Computer Science II - Formal Languages ‚Äã‚Äãand Computability, Programming II - Concepts of Programming Languages, Systems I - Hardware.

Transcript of records and syllabus are considered suitable proofs. Based on the documentation from the candidate, the competent committee will decide on the recommendation to the candidate. Documents must be in Slovenian or English. The candidate can object to the committee's recommendation by supplementing the application. The candidate sends the required documents to Student Services.

List for proposed mentors in the academic year 2025/26¬†for doctoral study programmes:

  • Computer Science,
  • Mathematical Sciences,
  • Renewable Materials for Healthy Built Environments,
  • Suicidology and Mental Health,
  • Conservation Biology.

Evidence of fulfillment of the admission requirements

The evidence of fulfillment of the admission requirements includes certificates and other requested documentation and is listed in the call for enrollment.

In case the certificate/diploma is issued in English, Italian or Croatian language the translation is not required. Candidates should first enquire about the translation.

Candidates who have completed a comparable study abroad must apply for the recognition of completed education prior to enrolment (as explained below in the section "Recognition of foreing diplomas").

Decision on admission and enrolment procedures

After the conclusion of the pre-enrolment procedures, each candidate receives a decision containing the information whether he/she has been accepted or not. The candidates having applied for enrolment obtain the decision on selection in September (the exact date will be published later).

If the application of the candidate is approved he/she receives also the invitation for the enrolment with detailed instructions for enrolment. A receipt certifying the payment of enrolment fees must be submitted upon enrolment. Students who are eligible for tuition must also submit a receipt certifying the payment of the first installment of the tuition fee. More about the payment of tuition and enrolment fees - here.

Candidates will enroll in the study programmes no later than 30 September 2025.

Co-funding tuition fees in doctoral studies¬†top

The co-funding of doctoral studies will be open to all students of the University of Primorska who meet the requirements from the Decree on co-Financing of doctoral studies and Criteria for the selection of candidates for co-funding tuition fees in doctoral studies at the University of Primorska.

In the academic year 2025/26, candidates for admission to the doctoral study programme will be able to show interest in co-funding the study. Candidates for enrollment can express interest in co-funding for doctoral studies by signing the Statement of eligibility for co-funding tuition fees in the academic year 2025/26.

The amount of co-funding will be published after the enrollment in the doctoral studies, which is expected in November. The amount of co-funding depends on the number of enrolled students who meet the criteria and the amount of funding for co-funding the doctoral study.

For more information please visit the website of the University of Primorska.

Year Plustop

What is Year Plus?

Year Plus enables foreign students to improve their academic performance by re-enrolling in the first year due to the reason of insufficient knowledge of the Slovenian language in which the study process takes place.

Year Plus for the purpose of re-enrolment in the 1st year of study must obtain at least 24 ECTS credit points from the study obligations of the programme in which they are enrolled, plus at least 6 ECTS credit points from the Slovenian language exam. Students must accumulate a total of at least 30 ECTS.

Target group of Year Plus

Foreign students who do not speak Slovene or whose knowledge of the Slovenian language is inadequate, are eligible to enrol in Year Plus provided that they are enrolled for the first time in one of the study programmes of UP FAMNIT conducted in the Slovenian language. They must be enrolled in the study programme before enrolling in Year Plus.

Obligations of a student enrolled in Year Plus

In the first year of study, students must pass the exam of the Slovenian language course with at least 6 ECTS credit points. In addition to the Slovenian language course, they must complete other study obligations in the curriculum of the study programme in which they are enrolled, in the amount of at least 24 ECTS credits (in total 30 ECTS). Any remaining study obligations from the first year may be completed by students in the next academic year, when they are still enrolled in the first year of the same study programme.

Rights of a student enrolled in Year Plus

Students enrolled in Year Plus will be allowed to re-enrol in the 1st year at the end of the current academic year (extension of student status) provided that the student has obtained at least 30 ECTS credits, including at least 6 ECTS credit points from the Slovenian language exam.

Enrolment in Year Plus

Students may enrol in Year Plus after enrolment at the faculty, but no later than 30 October of the current year. The application form will be sent to students who have the right to enrol in Year Plus by Student Services.

Recognition of foreign diplomastop

The procedure of recognition with a view to granting access to education is OBLIGATORY FOR ALL CANDIDATES WHO ARE HOLDERS OF FOREIGN DIPLOMAS and have not yet undergone the procedure of recognition. The recognition procedure is a procedure by which holders of foreign diplomas are issued decisions recognising their right to continue education in the Republic of Slovenia.

Certificates that do not require recognition are those from the former Yugoslav republics obtained before 25 June 1991 and International Baccalaureate (IB) certificates (the latest are equivalent to matura certificates obtained in the Republic of Slovenia).

For further information on the system of recognizing foreign diplomas see the¬†ENIC NARIC CENTRE Slovenia.

Recognition procedure

The procedure shall be initiated by the holder of a foreign diploma. The application for recognition is part of the application for enrolment in the study programme.

The recognition procedure is conducted as follows:

  • by the University of Primorska - ADMISSIONS OFFICE for candidates who wish to enrol in the first year of an undergraduate study programme;
  • by UP FAMNIT - Student Services for candidates who wish to enrol in the higher year of an undergraduate study programme or in the postgraduate study programme.

The decision shall be issued and published in the web portal eV≈† within two months after the date of receipt of a complete application. The procedure of recognition is free of charge for the candidate.

Documentation for the procedure of recognition

Candidates must upload on the web portal eV≈† the following documents:

  • the diploma to be recognised;
  • if the candidate will have to submit the original diploma, it must be legalised* on the basis of:
    • the 1961 Hague Convention at the court with territorial jurisdiction where the diploma has been issued); with properly filled in apostille form affixed or
    • the Authentication of Documents in International Traffic Act (available only in Slovene).
  • a certified Slovene translation of the diploma referred to in Item 1 (candidates should verify in the Student Services if the translation is necessary);
  • copy of the diploma supplement or some other evidence on the contents and duration of education (transcript or records);
  • a short chronological description of the entire education prepared by the candidate;
  • additional supporting documents will be required if the application cannot be processed on the basis of submitted documents.

* The legalisation of the diploma is not required for the following countries: Austria, Bulgaria, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, France, Greece, Croatia, Hungary, Macedonia, Romania.

We kindly ask all candidates to contact the Student Services before starting the recognition procedure.

Enrolment and tuition feestop

Enrolment fees, tuition fees and other study costs are set in the Price list of UP FAMNIT for each academic year.

General Terms and Conditions for the Payment of Tuition Fees and Charges¬†at UP FAMNIT are available HERE.

More information is available HERE.

Here's a **concise, action-focused summary** of key details from UP FAMNIT's enrollment guide (2025/26 academic year), prioritized for prospective students:

---

### üö® **Critical Deadlines & Current Status**
1. **Second Round Application Deadline**:  
   **October 31, 2024** (for most programs).  
   *Check [UP FAMNIT Admissions](https://www.upr.si/en/study/enrolment) for exact dates per program.*
2. **Year Plus Enrollment**:  
   Must apply by **October 30, 2024** (after enrollment at the faculty).

---

### üåê **Key Programs & Requirements**
#### ‚úÖ **Foreign Diplomas Recognition** *(Mandatory if applicable)*
- **Exemptions**: Certificates from Austria, Bulgaria, Bosnia/Herzegovina, Croatia, Cyprus, Czechia, France, Greece, Hungary, Macedonia, Romania, Serbia (no apostille needed).
- **Required Documents for Recognition**:
  - Diploma + certified Slovene translation.
  - Diploma supplement/transcript.
  - *Legalization*: Apostille via Hague Convention (or Authentication Act) unless exempt country.  
  ‚Üí **Contact [Student Services](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/student-services)** first to confirm requirements.

#### üá∏üáÆ **Year Plus Program** *(For non-Slovene speakers)*
- **Who qualifies**: Foreign students enrolled in Slovenian-language programs with inadequate language skills.
- **Requirements**:
  - Complete ‚â•24 ECTS from your program + **6 ECTS Slovenian language course** (total ‚â•30 ECTS).
  - Pass Slovenian exam *before* Year Plus extension.
- **Enrollment**: After faculty enrollment, ‚â§October 30.

---

### üí∞ **Funding & Fees**
#### üéì **Co-Funding for Doctoral Studies** *(2025/26)*
- Submit the [Statement of Eligibility](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/enrolment/statementcofunding-drstudies2025-2026.pdf) during enrollment.
- Amounts published in **November 2025** (depends on funding availability).
- Details: [UP FAMNIT Co-Funding Page](https://www.upr.si/en/4-study/co-funding-tuition-fees-of-public-doctoral-study-programmes).

#### üí∏ **Tuition Fees**
- Set annually in UP FAMNIT's Price List.
- Full terms: [General Conditions (English)](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/enrolment/famnitsplosnipogoji-eng21032024.pdf).

---

### ‚ö†Ô∏è **Critical Reminders**
| Section                  | Action Required                                                                 |
|--------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Foreign Diploma?         | **Contact Student Services FIRST** before applying for recognition.             |
| Slovenian language barrier? | Apply for **Year Plus by Oct 30, 2024** (after enrollment).                    |
| Doctoral co-funding?     | Submit the [Statement](https://www.famnit.upr.si/en/resources/files/education/enrolment/statementcofunding-drstudies2025-2026.pdf) during enrollment. |

---

### üîó **Essential Links**
1. [UP FAMNIT Admissions Portal](https://www.upr.si/en/study/enrolment)
2. [ENIC NARIC Centre (Diploma Recognition)](http://www.mvzt.gov.si/en/areas_of_work/enic_naric_center_slovenia/)
3. [Student Services Contact](http://www.famnit.upr.si/en/education/student-services)

This summary cuts through bureaucratic language to highlight **what you must do**. Focus on deadlines (Oct 31 for applications, Oct 30 for Year Plus) and mandatory steps (diploma recognition). For full details, refer to the official links provided above.
